introduction.p: In this chapter we define trigonometric functions. For a more extensive treatment of trigonometric functions we refer the reader to PreCalculus at Nebraska: College Trigonometry.

assemblage.p: A periodic functionperiodic function is a function whose output values repeat on a regular interval. In mathematical terms, we say that a periodic function is a function for which a specific horizontal shift, P, results in the original function: f(x+P)=f(x) for all values of x.
The periodperiod of a periodic function is how long it takes for the output values to begin repeating, or the smallest horizontal shift with P>0, such that f(x+P)=f(x) for all values of x.
